name: CoastalBlueCarbon
description:
Marine and terrestrial ecosystems help regulate Earth’s climate by adding and removing greenhouse gases (GHGs) such as carbon dioxide (CO2) to and from the atmosphere. Coastal marshes, mangroves, and seagrasses, in particular, store large amounts of carbon in their sediments, leaves, and other forms of biomass. In addition to storing carbon, marine ecosystems continually accumulate carbon in their sediments, creating large reservoirs of long-term sequestered carbon. By storing and sequestering carbon, marine ecosystems keep CO2 out of the atmosphere where it would otherwise contribute to climate change.

Management activities that change the cover of coastal vegetation, such as the restoration of seagrass beds and the clearing of mangrove forests, change the ability of coastal and marine areas to store and sequester carbon.

The InVEST Coastal Blue Carbon model attempts to predict the amount of carbon stored and sequestered over a coastal zone at particular points in time due to changes in land cover. Using an estimate of the monetary social value, or where available, a market price for stored and sequestered carbon, the InVEST Coastal Blue Carbon model also quantifies the marginal value of storage and sequestration.

inputParams.name: Land_Use_Land_Cover_Lookup_Table
inputParams.description: CSV table used to map land use/land cover (LULC) classes to their values in a raster and to indicate whether or not the LULC class is a coastal blue carbon habitat.
inputParams.label: Land Use/Land Cover Lookup Table (.csv)

inputParams.name: Land_Use_Land_Cover_Transition_Table
inputParams.description: CSV table where rows represent the base land use/land cover (LULC) classes and columns represent the transition LULC classes.
inputParams.label: Land Use/Land Cover Transition Table (.csv)

inputParams.name: Carbon_Pool_Initial_Table
inputParams.description: CSV table containing information related to the initial conditions of the carbon stock within each of the three pools of a habitat. Biomass includes carbon stored above and below ground. All non-coastal blue carbon habitat LULC classes are assumed to contain no carbon. The values for ‘biomass’, ‘soil’, and ‘litter’ should be given in terms of Megatonnes CO2e /ha.
inputParams.label: Carbon Pool Initial Table (.csv)

inputParams.name: Carbon_Pool_Transient_Table
inputParams.description: CSV table containing information related to the transition of carbon into and out of coastal blue carbon pools. All non-coastal blue carbon habitat land use/land cover (LULC)  classes are assumed to neither sequester nor emit carbon as a result of change. The ‘yearly-accumulation’ values should be given in terms of Megatonnes of CO2e /ha-yr. The ‘half-life’ values must be given in terms of years. The ‘disturbance’ values must be given as a decimal percentage of stock disturbed given a transition occurs away from a particular LULC class.
inputParams.label: Carbon Pool Transient Table (.csv)

inputParams.name: Baseline_Raster
inputParams.description: A GDAL-supported raster file representing the landscape/seascape at the initial point of time.
inputParams.label: Baseline Raster Map

inputParams.name: Baseline_Year
inputParams.description: Type in the year corresponding to the baseline raster file provided above.
inputParams.label: Baseline Year

inputParams.name: Transition_Raster
inputParams.description: GDAL-supported raster representing the landscape/seascape at particular (future) point in time.
inputParams.label: Transition Raster Map

inputParams.name: Transition_Year
inputParams.description: Type in the year corresponding to the provided land use/land cover (LULC) transition raster.
inputParams.label: Transition Year

inputParams.name: Run_Economic_Analysis
inputParams.description: Boolean type of data. If checked (default), net present value of sequestered carbon will be calculated.
inputParams.label: Run Economic Analysis

inputParams.name: Use_Price_Table
inputParams.description: Boolean type of data. If checked, a price table will be used to calculate net present value of sequestered carbon.
inputParams.label: Use Price Table

inputParams.name: Price
inputParams.description: The price per Megatonne CO2e at the baseline year.
inputParams.label: Price (currency units)

inputParams.name: Interest_Rate
inputParams.description: The interest rate on the price per Megatonne CO2e, compounded yearly.
inputParams.label: Interest Rate (%)

inputParams.name: Discount_Rate
inputParams.description: The discount rate on future valuations of sequestered carbon, compounded yearly.
inputParams.label: Discount Rate (%)

inputParams.name: Price_Table
inputParams.description: Only needed when the use price table variable is checked. Can be used in place of price and interest rate inputs. The provided CSV table contains the price per Megatonne CO2e sequestered for a given year, for all years from the original snapshot to the analysis year, if provided.
inputParams.label: Price Table (.csv) (Optional)
